description: This course helps students better understand human development from the moment of conception and across the life span. The course focuses on biological and environmental factors that shape human development. Major changes in physical, cognitive, personality and social development are discussed. Prerequisite: Psychology 125. Offered each semester. Counts toward nursing and social work majors and educational studies and family studies concentrations.
name: Developmental Psych
prerequisites: Psychology 125. Offered each semester. Counts toward nursing and social work majors and educational studies and family studies concentrations.
